Class Gameboard

java.lang.Object
gameboard.Gameboard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Gameboard extends Object implements Serializable
The Gameboard class is responsible for tracking player, monster and treasure position.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Gameboard

      public Gameboard(Level level)
      Constructs a Gameboard instance with the parameters from the level object.
      Parameters:
      level - Level object, holding level parameters, needed for game board creation

  • Method Details

    • movePlayer

      public Event movePlayer(int newCordX, int newCordY)
      Moves the player on the game board. If the player steps into an event, the event instance is created and returned.
      Parameters:
      newCordX - new X coordinate of the player
      newCordY - new Y coordinate of the player
      Returns:
      Event instance of the encountered event

    • isCellWall

      private boolean isCellWall(int x, int y)
      Check if a cell on the game board is a wall.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinates of the cell
      y - Y coordinates of the cell
      Returns:
      Boolean if the cell is a wall

    • isCordOutOfBounds

      private boolean isCordOutOfBounds(int x, int y)
      Check if a cell on the game board is out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinates of the cell
      y - Y coordinates of the cell
      Returns:
      Boolean if the cell is out of bounds

    • isMazeExit

      public boolean isMazeExit(int x, int y)
      Check if a cell on the game board is the maze exit.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinates of the cell
      y - Y coordinates of the cell
      Returns:
      Boolean if the cell is the maze exit

      y - Y coordinates of the cell
